oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cultivation, processing and nutritional aspects for pigs and poultry of European protein sources as alternatives for imported soybean products
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: van Krimpen, M.M.
Bikker, P.
van der Meer, I.M.
van der Peet-Schwering, C.M.C.
Vereijken, J.M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Cereals, pulses and oilseeds
Feeding and growth
Pigs
Poultry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this study, the conditions are described for successfully cultivation, processing and applying alternative protein sources in (organic) pig and poultry diets under European climatic conditions, thereby taking sustainability characteristics, and legislative aspects into account.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: van Krimpen, M.M.; Bikker, P.; van der Meer, I.M.; van der Peet-Schwering, C.M.C. and Vereijken, J.M. (2013) Cultivation, processing and nutritional aspects for pigs and poultry of European protein sources as alternatives for imported soybean products. Wagen√≠ngen UR Livestock Research - partner in livestock innovations, no. Report 662. Wageningen UR Livestock Research, The Netherland, Lelystad.
